Posts.Content: Dec 16, 2008 10:20AM girliebiker wrote: I also had terrible and frequent hot flashes. My oncologist suggested that I try neurontin 300 mg three times per day. It works beautifully. I still have about 4-5 hot flashes per day but they are much, much less severe. I'm so thankful for neurontin.
Posts.Title: Hot Flashes Bonnie46 girliebiker

Posts.Content: girliebiker wrote: I was told yesterday that I have metastasis to my spine. This is my first diagnosis of breast cancer. I start Herceptin and Navelbine this Friday. Are there any stories similar to mine that have lived long, productive lives? Naturally, I'm afraid but also hopeful. Dx 1/28/2008, IDC, 2cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 4/13 nodes, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: 1st dx includes metastasis girliebiker LilWarrior

Posts.Content: Jan 29, 2008 02:02PM girliebiker wrote: So happy to hear that you are still going strong. My oncologist has mentioned radiation to the mets if the Herceptin and Navelbine don't relieve the pain. Has your pain gone?
Posts.Title: 1st dx includes metastasis girliebiker LilWarrior

Posts.Content: Jan 29, 2008 01:59PM girliebiker wrote: I am 66 years old and some might say I've lived a long life already, but I have lots more to do....including watching my grandchildren grow up!!
